text: Hello, welcome to Persona, a horror-mystery physics puzzle game.
The gameplay revolves around exploring the disorienting world, solving puzzles, and piecing together the fragmented story to understand the characters' identities and their relationship.
You are currently playing the CMPM120 playtest version for 6/7/23. Game and Art by skysfalling
Let's start with the basics. Use the Arrow Keys to move us.,
Blue and I... we're like reflections. When you move me up, Blue goes down and vice versa.
But hey, we're not just wandering around aimlessly, you know.
Sometimes, when Blue and I drift apart, you'll see things that you wouldn't normally see when we're close. Echoes of the past, of what once was...
There will be times when Blue and I can tether ourselves to objects. To do that, you need to press Z or X.
Some objects are stubborn, won't budge no matter how hard you try.
Other objects are swayed by our presence. You can pull them along with you.
It's useful, especially when we need to bring hearts to those lonely cats around the level.
Blue likes taking care of the kitties. These cats are symbolic in many ways, representing parts of Blue's and my past... parts of ourselves.
They're stuck in this world just like we are. And, they need our help to move on. It's sort of poetic, don't you think?
Now, each cat has a specific color associated with it - same as the hearts that are scattered around.
Your task is to guide either me or Blue, or sometimes both of us, to tether ourselves to the heart and then bring it to the corresponding cat.
And that's all we have for you today! Have fun :)
